name: Coin Minting

pages.text: $(thing)Coin Mints$() are the main tool for customizing your $(thing)coins$(). They allow you to imprint various designs onto unminted $(thing)coins$() by using a $(thing)Bottom Die$() and $(thing)Top Die$() of at least the same or higher metal tier as the $(thing)coin$() you are trying to mint.
The $(thing)Die Holder$() is the lower brass part of the $(thing)Coin Mint$(), holding the $(thing)Bottom Die$().
The $(thing)Stamp Holder$() is the upper brass part of the $(thing)Coin Mint$(), holding the $(thing)Top Die$().

To use the $(thing)Coin Mint$(), you first need to insert both a $(thing)Bottom Die$() and $(thing)Top Die$(). This is done by interacting with the appropriate $(thing)die$() in your hand on the brass parts intended to hold the respective die type. Once this is done, you can insert the $(thing)coins$() you want to mint by using it anywhere on the $(thing)Coin Mint$() hitbox except the brass parts.
Where to look for the $(thing)Bottom Die$()

The last step is stamping the image onto the $(thing)coin$(). This is achieved by using a $(thing)hammer$() on the $(thing)Coin Mint$(). $(br2) The minted $(thing)coin$() will be stored on the edge of the $(thing)Coin Mint$(), retrievable by interacting with the base.

If you want to change anything you inserted into your $(thing)Coin Mint$(), you can just interact with the respective part while you are crouching. This can be useful if you want to make $(thing)coins$() with various designs.
